text: Kenneth McAlpine, OBE DL (21 September 1920 â€“ 8 April 2023) was a British racing driver. He was born in Cobham, Surrey. He participated in 7 Formula One World Championship Grands Prix, debuting on 19 July 1952. He scored no championship points. During the development of the Connaught Racing Team based at Send in Surrey, McAlpine became a considerable financial backer and enjoyed several team owner triumphs including Tony Brooks's memorable F1 victory at Syracuse, Italy in 1955. McAlpine died on 8 April 2023, at the age of 102.McAlpine .
